For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. The objects of this class contain necessary information to reproduce current view including camera type, position and orientation as well as objects visibility property and their positions (if different from default) Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. setWebGLContextAttributes.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getWebGLContextAttributes webGLContextAttributes}. Optional WebGL context attributes. A JSON object with the following boolean properties:
  • antialias {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will attempt to perform antialiased rendering if possible.
  • alpha {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will have an alpha (transparency) channel.
  • premultipliedAlpha {boolean} default value false. If set to true, the color channels in the framebuffer will be stored premultiplied by the alpha channel to improve performance.
Other {@link https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/specs/latest/1.0/#5.2 WebGL context attributes} are also supported. WebGL context attributes cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is ...see text or source.

sap.ui.vk.Viewer.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Viewer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableSceneTree enableSceneTree} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowSceneTree showSceneTree} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableStepNavigation enableStepNavigation} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableNotifications enableNotifications} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowStepNavigation showStepNavigation} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowStepNavigationThumbnails showStepNavigationThumbnails} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getOverlayStepNavigation overlayStepNavigation} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableLayersPanel enableLayersPanel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowLayersPanel showLayersPanel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableElementsPanel enableElementsPanel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowElementsPanel showElementsPanel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnablePageGallery enablePageGallery} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowPageGallery showPageGallery} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableToolbar enableToolbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableProgressIndicator enableProgressIndicator} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowDrawerToolbar showDrawerToolbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableMiniMap enableMiniMap} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowMiniMap showMiniMap} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getToolbarTitle toolbarTitle} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getShouldTrackVisibilityChanges shouldTrackVisibilityChanges} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getRecursiveSelection recursiveSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getRuntimeSettings runtimeSettings} : object (default: {})
    • {@link #getWebGLContextAttributes webGLContextAttributes} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getHotspotsEnabled hotspotsEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowAllHotspots showAllHotspots} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getHotspotColorABGR hotspotColorABGR} : int (default: 0x590000BB)
    • {@link #getHotspotColor hotspotColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: "rgba(89, 0, 0, 0.73)")
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContentResources contentResources} : sap.ui.vk.ContentResource[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:contentResourceChangesProcessed contentResourceChangesProcessed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:sceneLoadingSucceeded sceneLoadingSucceeded} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:sceneLoadingFailed sceneLoadingFailed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:sceneDestroying sceneDestroying} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionChanged selectionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fullScreen fullScreen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:urlClicked urlClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:nodeClicked nodeClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy.!description:
Provides a simple, lightweight proxy object to a node in a node hierarchy. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateChildren sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateChildren}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateAncestors sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateAncestors}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager#enumerateSelection sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager.enumerateSelection}

parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The ID or reference (depending on the concrete BaseNodeProxy implementation) of the node for which to get BaseNodeProxy.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy.

getName.!description: Gets the name of the node.

getNodeId.!description: Gets the ID of the node.

getNodeMetadata.!description: Gets the metadata of the node.

getNodeRef.!description: Gets the reference object of the node.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new BaseNodeProxy. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateChildren sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateChildren}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#enumerateAncestors sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateAncestors}
  • {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager#enumerateSelection sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager.enumerateSelection}
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.Object#constructor sap.ui.base.Object} can be used.

Provides a simple, lightweight proxy object to a node in a node hierarchy. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:

sap.ui.vk.tools.MoveTool.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MoveTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCoordinateSystem coordinateSystem} : sap.ui.vk.tools.CoordinateSystem (default: World)
    • {@link #getPlacementMode placementMode} : sap.ui.vk.tools.GizmoPlacementMode (default: ObjectCenter)
    • {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableSnapping enableSnapping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEditingUI showEditingUI} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAutoResetValues autoResetValues} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAllowContextMenu allowContextMenu} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getNodeSet nodeSet} : sap.ui.vk.tools.ToolNodeSet (default: Highlight)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:moving moving} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:moved moved} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:coordinateSystemChanged coordinateSystemChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:placementModeChanged placementModeChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.

getPlacementMode.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getPlacementMode placementMode}. Sets the placement mode. Can be Default, ObjectCenter, or Custom Default value is ObjectCenter.

getAutoResetValues.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAutoResetValues autoResetValues}. Determines if auto reset values mode is enabled Default value is true.

attachMoved.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:moved moved} event of this sap.ui.vk.tools.MoveTool. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.tools.MoveTool itself. This event will be fired when movement finished. This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has four properties: {any} node: node reference, {float[]} offsetToRest, translate relative to rest position in local coordinates {float[]} offsetToPrevious, translate relative to end position of previous sequence or rest position if no previous sequence in local coordinates {float[]} absolute, translate in parent coordinates {float[]} world, translate in world coordinates {float[]} restDifference, change of rest position translation in parent coordinates {float[]} restDifferenceInCoordinates, change of rest position translation in current coordinates
attachMoved.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.vk.tools.MoveTool

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.vk.tools.MoveTool itself
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

setEnableStepping.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping}. If set to true values will change in round number increments instead of continual change When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. sap.ui.vk.Annotation.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Annotation. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getAnnotationId annotationId} : string
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getNodeRef nodeRef} : any
    • {@link #getText text} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getStyle style} : sap.ui.vk.AnnotationStyle (default: Default)
    • {@link #getDisplay display} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAnimate animate} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAnimationDelay animationDelay} : float (default: -1)
    • {@link #getSelected selected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getXCoordinate xCoordinate} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getYCoordinate yCoordinate} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getXOffset xOffset} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getYOffset yOffset} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : float
    • {@link #getWidth width} : float
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTextEditor textEditor} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Associations
    • {@link #getViewport viewport} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.Viewport)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.RedlineElement.!constructorDescription:
Base class for redline elements such as {@link sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementRectangle}, {@link sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementEllipse}, {@link sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementFreehand}, {@link sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementLine}, {@link sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementText}. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getOriginX originX} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getOriginY originY} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getOpacity opacity} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getStrokeWidth strokeWidth} : float (default: 2)
    • {@link #getStrokeColor strokeColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: "#e6600d")
    • {@link #getStrokeDashArray strokeDashArray} : float[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getHalo halo} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getHaloColor haloColor} : string (default: "rgba(255, 0, 0, 1)")
    • {@link #getCreatedByUser createdByUser} : any (default: "")
    • {@link #getCreateTimestamp createTimestamp} : int
    • {@link #getDeletedByUser deletedByUser} : any (default: "")
    • {@link #getDeleteTimestamp deleteTimestamp} : int
    • {@link #getSuppress suppress} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getElementId elementId} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.IncludeUsageIdType.!description:
This type defines possible valid values for property {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource#getIncludeUsageId ContentResource.includeUsageId}. The possible valid values:
  • true - Load all UsageIds. This is potentially very expensive, as there could be many UsageIds defined for the tenant which are not relevant to the current application.
  • false - Do not load any UsageIds.
  • string - A single non-empty string which defines the name of the requested UsageId.
  • string[] - An array of non-empty strings which define the names of requested UsageIds.

addContentManagerResolver.!description:
Adds a new content manager resolver.

The last added resolver will be executed the first.

Content manager resolver analyzes the content resource definition and returns the type of the content manager to use for loading the content resource.

The simplest resolver tests the content resource source type. The test can be either a string comparison or a regular expression.

A more sophisticated resolver is a function that can use the full content resource definition to find a proper content manager dynamically, e.g. the resolver can use the 'HEAD' HTTP request to get the 'Content-Type' header to find out the type of the content resource.

parameters.resolver:
type: function|object, description: Object that defines how to find out the content manager class name.
If resolver is a function then this function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource sap.ui.vk.ContentResource} and returns a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise Promise} that resolves with an object with the following properties:
  • dimension: int - dimension of the model. E.g. 2 or 3.
  • contentManagerClassName: string - name of content manager class to use for loading the content resource.
  • settings: object - optional settings specific to the content manager.
    See {@link sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager}.
If resolver is an object then it has the following properties:

detachContentChangesProgress.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:contentChangesProgress contentChangesProgress} event of this sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

setRetryCount.!description:
Sets the maximum number of retry attempts for a download operation if the initial request to retrieve a model from a remote server could not be fulfilled and the error with which the request failed is considered recoverable.

Retry Mechanism

Requests to retrieve (download) a model from a remote server may not always be fulfilled. If the request failed with an error that is considered recoverable then the download manager will keep on trying issuing new requests until the request is fulfilled or the specified retryCount is exceeded. The default number of retry attempts is 1, unless specified otherwise by calling this method. Note that, specifying 0 as retryCount disables the retry mechanism altogether. Timing of retry attempts: There is no delay between subsequent attempts. Events fired: The download manager will not fire any events between subsequent attempts. For each requested item there will be a single itemSucceeded or itemFailed event fired when the download operation for that given item finishes. Recoverable errors: The following errors are considered recoverable:
  • Any kind of network error (e.g. due to temporary network outage). HTTP status code is expected to be 0.
  • Responses with the following 4xx-5xx HTTP status codes:
    • 408: Request Timeout
    • 425: Too Early (RFC 8470)
    • 429: Too Many Requests (RFC 6585)
    • 500: Internal Server Error
    • 502: Bad Gateway
    • 503: Service Unavailable
    • 504: Gateway Timeout

parameters.retryCount: type: int, description: Maximum number of retry attempts. Value must be non-negative. The default retry count is 1, unless specified otherwise by calling this method and passing in the desired value. Passing in 0 disables any retry attempts.

sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ContentConnector. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContentResources contentResources} : sap.ui.vk.ContentResource[] (default)
    • {@link #getViewStateManagers viewStateManagers} : sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManagerBase[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:contentChangesStarted contentChangesStarted} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contentChangesFinished contentChangesFinished} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contentChangesProgress contentChangesProgress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contentLoadingFinished contentLoadingFinished} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contentReplaced contentReplaced} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contentDestroying contentDestroying} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.SceneTree.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new SceneTree. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getShowTitle showTitle} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowSearchField showSearchField} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLegacyVisibilityMode legacyVisibilityMode} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTreeTable treeTable} : sap.ui.table.TreeTable
  • Associations
    • {@link #getContentConnector contentConnector} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector)
    • {@link #getViewStateManager viewStateManager} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManagerBase)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:contentChanged contentChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getTitle.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTitle title}. Text to be displayed in title bar of scene tree Default value is ...see text or source.

getContentConnector.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getContentConnector contentConnector}, or null.

setShowSearchField.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowSearchField showSearchField}. Show or hide search field When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowSearchField: type: boolean, description: New value for property showSearchField

getLegacyVisibilityMode.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getLegacyVisibilityMode legacyVisibilityMode}. In legacy visibility mode all changes in node visibility also apply to all descendent nodes Default value is false.

detachContentChanged.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:contentChanged contentChanged} event of this sap.ui.vk.SceneTree. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.
detachContentChanged.!type: fn(fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.vk.SceneTree

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

loadContentResourcesAsync.!description:
Loads content resources.

Content resources can be downloaded from a URL or loaded from a local file.
loadContentResourcesAsync.!type: fn(contentResources: [sap.ui.vk.ContentResource], onComplete: fn(), onProgress: fn()) -> sap.ui.vk.dvl.GraphicsCore

parameters.onProgress: type: function, description: The callback function to call to report the file loading progress.
parameters.contentResources: type: sap.ui.vk.ContentResource[], description: The content resources to build the scene from.
parameters.onComplete: type: function, description: The callback function to call when all content resources are processed. The onComplete callback parameter sourcesFailedToLoad takes an array of objects with the properties: source (The content resource that failed to load), status (The VIT Message code i.e 'VIT22') and statusText (VIT Message Summary).

setRetryCount.!description:
Sets the maximum number of retry attempts for a download operation if the initial request to retrieve a model from a remote server could not be fulfilled and the error with which the request failed is considered recoverable.

See {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector#setRetryCount} for details.

parameters.retryCount: type: int, description: Maximum number of retry attempts. Value must be non-negative. The default number of retry attempts is 1, unless specified otherwise by calling this method and passing in the desired value. Specifying 0 disables any retry attempts.

updateSceneTree.!description:

parameters.onError: type: function, description: The callback function to call when an error happens.
parameters.contentResources: type: sap.ui.vk.ContentResource[], description: The array of content resources to update or build the scene from.

parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The reference object of the node whose ancestors will be returned.

createNode.!type: fn(parentNode: THREE.Object3D, name: String, insertBeforeNode: THREE.Object3D, nodeContentType?: sap.ui.vk.NodeContentType, content?: Object) -> THREE.Object3D

parameters.name: type: string, description: The name of the new node.
parameters.insertBeforeNode: type: THREE.Object3D, description: The created node is added before this specified node. If equals null the newly created node is added at the end of the parent's list of nodes.
parameters.parentNode: type: THREE.Object3D, description: The reference object of the parent node where the created node is added to. If equals null the newly created node is a top level node.
parameters.content: type: object, description: Optional Json structure used to define node properties.
parameters.nodeContentType: type: sap.ui.vk.NodeContentType, description: The created node content type.

enumerateAncestors.!description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.
enumerateAncestors.!type: fn(nodeRef: Object, callback: fn(), passNodeRef?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.threejs.NodeHierarchy

parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The reference object of a node whose ancestor nodes we want enumerated.
parameters.passNodeRef:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to pass the node references of the ancestor nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the ancestor nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: type: string, description: The name of the new node.
parameters.insertBeforeNode: type: any, description: The created node is added before this specified node. If equals null the newly created node is added at the end of the parent's list of nodes.
parameters.nodeToCopy: type: any, description: The reference object of the node to copy.
parameters.parentNode: type: any, description: The reference object of the parent node where the created node is added to. If equals null the newly created node is a top level node.

getHotspotNodeRefs.!description: Returns a list of hotspot node references.

findNodesByUsageIdPath.!description: Find nodes by UsageId path. The method can return multiple nodes matching path especially when path contains a string "**".

parameters.usageIdName: type: string, description: A UsageId name which the keys in path belong to.
parameters.path: type: any[], description: An array of UsageId keys where each item is a single JSON like object with properties name and value for single-key UsageIds and an array of such objects for multi-key UsageIds. The item can can be a string "*" to indicate that it can be any node or the item can be a string "**" to indicate that some nodes can be skipped.
parameters.options: type: object, description: Optional settings for the method.

Creates a layer proxy object.

The layer proxy object must be destroyed with the {@link #destroyLayerProxy destroyLayerProxy} method.

parameters.layerId: type: string, description: The layer ID for which to create a proxy object.

parameters.nodeProxy: type: sap.ui.vk.NodeProxy, description: The node proxy object.

sap.ui.vk.threejs.NodeHierarchy.!description:
Provides the ability to explore a Scene object's node structure.

The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created via a call to {@link sap.ui.vk.Scene#getDefaultNodeHierarchy sap.ui.vk.Scene#getDefaultNodeHierarchy}.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.vk.threejs.NodeHierarchy.

parameters.layerProxy: type: sap.ui.vk.LayerProxy, description: The layer proxy object.

enumerateChildren.!description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback function are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.
enumerateChildren.!type: fn(nodeRef?: Object, callback: fn(), stepIntoClosedNodes?: Boolean, passNodeRef?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.threejs.NodeHierarchy

parameters.nodeRef:
type: any, description: The reference object of a node whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.
parameters.passNodeRef:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to pass the node references of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child node references are passed to the callback function.
parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.
parameters.stepIntoClosedNodes:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated

parameters.name: type: string, description: The name of the new node.
parameters.insertBeforeNode: type: any, description: The created node is added before this specified node. If equals null the newly created node is added at the end of the parent's list of nodes.
parameters.parentNode: type: any, description: The parent node reference where the created node is added to. If equals null the newly created node is a top level node.

enumerateAncestors.!description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.
enumerateAncestors.!type: fn(nodeRef: Object, callback: fn(), passNodeRef?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.dvl.NodeHierarchy

parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The node reference whose ancestor nodes we want enumerated.
parameters.passNodeRef:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to pass the node references of the ancestor nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the ancestor nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.dvl.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

Provides the ability to explore a Scene object's node structure. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created via a call to {@link sap.ui.vk.Scene#getDefaultNodeHierarchy sap.ui.vk.Scene.getDefaultNodeHierarchy}.

enumerateChildren.!description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback function are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.
enumerateChildren.!type: fn(nodeRef?: Object, callback: fn(), stepIntoClosedNodes?: Boolean, passNodeRef?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.dvl.NodeHierarchy

parameters.nodeRef:
type: any, description: The node reference whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.
parameters.passNodeRef:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to pass the node references of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child node references are passed to the callback function.
parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.dvl.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.
parameters.stepIntoClosedNodes:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated

sap.ui.vk.tools.CreateEllipseTool.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CreateEllipseTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getParentNode parentNode} : any
    • {@link #getUniformMode uniformMode} : boolean (default: false)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:completed completed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.

allowOperation.!description: Indicates the type of allowed operations

closePath.!description: Flag to always create closed path elements.

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

nodeSet.!description: Determine what set of nodes will be transformed with this tool

axis.!description: Controls which axis are rotatable around. Can be All, X, Y, or Z

uniformScaleEnabled.!description: If set to true then this tool will enable uniform scaling.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

active.!description: Used to control the tool rendering and interaction pipeline.

uniformMode.!description: Indicates that the tool creates a square instead of a rectangle.

allowContextMenu.!description: Whether or not to allow context menu on right-click

nodeList.!description: Defines a list of nodes to be duplicated.

quaternion.!description: The anchor point tool quaternion. This property is read-only.

nonUniformScaleEnabled.!description: If set to true then this tool will enable scaling along a single axis, otherwise it will scale objects along all three axes proportionally

showEditingUI.!description: Display text box with current value, which can also be used to directly modify the value

position.!description: The anchor point tool position in the world coordinate system. This property is read-only.

subtractMode.!description: If set to true then this tool will remove selected nodes from the selection set. Default is to always add them to the selection

IdMode.!description: Indicates what schema the tool should use to extract IDs from hit objects

enableStepping.!description: If set to true values will change in round number increments instead of continual change

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

coordinateSystem.!description: Select coordinate system in which this tool operates. Can be Local, World, Parent, Screen or Custom

editable.!description: Determines if elements editing is enabled

placementMode.!description: Sets the placement mode. Can be Default, ObjectCenter, or Custom

autoResetValues.!description: Determines if auto reset values mode is enabled

toolid.!description: GUID identifier for the tool to prevent naming conflicts.

footprint.!description: Used to decide whether this tool should be enabled for the target viewport.

    • {@link #getSelectionMode selectionMode} : sap.m.ListMode (default: MultiSelect)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.m.ListItemBase[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:headerIconPress headerIconPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:expand expand} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionChange selectionChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:itemPress itemPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

parameters.name: type: string, description: The name of the new node.

parameters.parentNode: type: sap.ui.vk.svg.Element, description: The reference object of the parent node where the created node is added to. If equals null the newly created node is a top level node.
parameters.content: type: object, description: Optional Json structure used to define node properties.
parameters.nodeContentType: type: sap.ui.vk.NodeContentType, description: The created node content type.

enumerateAncestors.!description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.
enumerateAncestors.!type: fn(nodeRef: Object, callback: fn(), passNodeRef?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.svg.NodeHierarchy

parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The reference object of a node whose ancestor nodes we want enumerated.
parameters.passNodeRef:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to pass the node references of the ancestor nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the ancestor nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#constructor sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy} can be used.

parameters.nodeToCopy: type: any, description: The reference object of the node to copy.
parameters.parentNode: type: any, description: The reference object of the parent node where the created node is added to. If equals null the newly created node is a top level node.

sap.ui.vk.svg.NodeHierarchy.!description:
Provides the ability to explore a Scene object's node structure.

The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created via a call to {@link sap.ui.vk.Scene#getDefaultNodeHierarchy sap.ui.vk.Scene#getDefaultNodeHierarchy}.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.vk.svg.NodeHierarchy.

parameters.layerProxy: type: sap.ui.vk.LayerProxy, description: The layer proxy object.

getDynamicContentNodeRefs.!description: Returns a list of dynamic content node references.

enumerateChildren.!description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback function are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.
enumerateChildren.!type: fn(nodeRef?: Object, callback: fn(), stepIntoClosedNodes?: Boolean, passNodeRef?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.svg.NodeHierarchy

parameters.nodeRef:
type: any, description: The reference object of a node whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.
parameters.passNodeRef:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to pass the node references of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child node references are passed to the callback function.
parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.
parameters.stepIntoClosedNodes:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated

Creates a node proxy object.

The node proxy object must be destroyed with the {@link #destroyNodeProxy destroyNodeProxy} method.

parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The reference object for which to create a proxy object.
type: any, description: The node reference

sap.ui.vk.ToggleMenuButton.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ToggleMenuButton. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getType type} : sap.m.ButtonType (default: Default)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIconDensityAware iconDensityAware} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMenuPosition menuPosition} : sap.ui.core.Popup.Dock (default: BeginBottom)
    • {@link #getTextDirection textDirection} : sap.ui.core.TextDirection (default: Inherit)
    • {@link #getPressed pressed} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.vk.ToggleMenuItem[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getDefaultItem defaultItem} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.ToggleMenuItem)
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:beforeMenuOpen beforeMenuOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:itemToggled itemToggled} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:itemSelected itemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

addAriaLabelledBy.!description: Adds some ariaLabelledBy into the association {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

setIconDensityAware.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIconDensityAware iconDensityAware}. When set to truefalse to avoid the attempt of fetching density perfect image. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bIconDensityAware: type: boolean, description: New value for property iconDensityAware

getEnabled.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. Boolean property to enable the control (default is true). Note: Depending on custom settings, the buttons that are disabled have other colors than the enabled ones. Default value is true.

removeAriaLabelledBy.!description: Removes an ariaLabelledBy from the association named {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: int|sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to be removed or its index or ID

setMenuPosition.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMenuPosition menuPosition}. Specifies the position of the popup menu with enumerated options. By default, the control opens the menu at its bottom left side. Note: In the case that the menu has no space to show itself in the view port of the current window it tries to open itself to the inverted direction. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is BeginBottom.

Template control for Procedure items.

destroyThumbnailsContainer.!description: Destroys the thumbnailsContainer in the aggregation {@link #getThumbnailsContainer thumbnailsContainer}.

getProceduresAndSteps.!description: Returns the procedures list with steps for the current scene, and appends base64 data as thumbnailData and an image type as thumbnailType.

Gets current value of property {@link #getSettings settings}.

Managed settings and properties for Step Navigation events.

getStep.!description: Gets a step based on a positive or negative integer, which is used as an index relative to the index of the current step. An index value of 0 can be used to retrieve the details of the current step.
getStep.!type: fn(relIndex: Number, procedureIndex?: Number, specificStepId: String) -> JSON

parameters.procedureIndex: type: number, description: Optional integer representing the index of the target procedure in the procedures list.
parameters.specificStepId: type: string, description: The ID of the step that we want to retrieve.
parameters.relIndex: type: number, description: Positive or negative integer representing the number to add or subtract from the index of the current step to return the desired step; for example, //next 1, current 0, previous -1

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}. Width of the Step Navigation control. Default value is "100%".

parameters.oContentConnector: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector, description: ID of an element which becomes the new target of this contentConnector association; alternatively, an element instance may be given

getShowThumbnails.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowThumbnails showThumbnails}. Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display thumbnails. If set to true, then thumbnails are rendered. If set to false, then thumbnails are hidden. Default value is true.

getHeight.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}. Height of the Step Navigation control. Default value is "100%".

getLayout.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getLayout layout}.

sap.m.Toolbar used to render the entire Step Navigation control's content.

sap.ui.vk.StepNavigation.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new StepNavigation. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSettings settings} : object
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "100%")
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "100%")
    • {@link #getShowThumbnails showThumbnails} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowToolbar showToolbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowStepInfo showStepInfo} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getProcedureItemTemplate procedureItemTemplate} : sap.ui.core.Item
    • {@link #getStepInfoPopup stepInfoPopup} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getLayout layout} : sap.m.Toolbar
    • {@link #getThumbnailsContainer thumbnailsContainer} : sap.m.ScrollContainer
  • Associations
    • {@link #getContentConnector contentConnector} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:resize resize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:stepChanged stepChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getContentConnector.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getContentConnector contentConnector}, or null.

playStep.!type: fn(stepId: String, fromTheBeginning: Boolean, continueToTheNext: Boolean)

parameters.continueToTheNext: type: boolean, description: Default: false If true, tells the Viewer to play the next step in sequence.
parameters.fromTheBeginning: type: boolean, description: Default: true If true, tells the Viewer to play the step from the first frame.
parameters.stepId: type: string, description: The ID of the procedure step to play.

detachStepChanged.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:stepChanged stepChanged} event of this sap.ui.vk.StepNavigation. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.
detachStepChanged.!type: fn(fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.vk.StepNavigation

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

getStepInfoPopup.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getStepInfoPopup stepInfoPopup}.

sap.ui.core.Popup used to render step information in a popup.

destroyStepInfoPopup.!description: Destroys the stepInfoPopup in the aggregation {@link #getStepInfoPopup stepInfoPopup}.

parameters.oProcedureItemTemplate: type: sap.ui.core.Item, description: The procedureItemTemplate to set

setScene.!description: Attaches a Scene object to the Step Navigation control so that it can access the Scene’s procedures and steps.

parameters.scene: type: object, description: The Scene object to attach to the Step Navigation control.

getShowStepInfo.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowStepInfo showStepInfo}. Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display a popup containing information around the step that is playing. If set to true, then the popup is rendered. If set to false, the popup is hidden. Default value is false.

clear.!description: Clears the content of the Step Navigation control.

refresh.!description: Rebuilds the content of the Step Navigation control from the current Scene.

parameters.oScene: type: object, description: The scene object to be used.

setShowThumbnails.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowThumbnails showThumbnails}. Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display thumbnails. If set to true, then thumbnails are rendered. If set to false, then thumbnails are hidden. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowThumbnails: type: boolean, description: New value for property showThumbnails

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. Width of the Step Navigation control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "100%".

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property width

setAllowContextMenu.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getAllowContextMenu allowContextMenu}. Whether or not to allow context menu on right-click When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bAllowContextMenu: type: boolean, description: New value for property allowContextMenu

getEnableSnapping.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableSnapping enableSnapping}. Determines if snapping when rotating is enabled Default value is false.

attachRotating.!description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:rotating rotating} event of this sap.ui.vk.tools.AxisAngleRotationTool. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.tools.AxisAngleRotationTool itself. This event will be fired when rotation finished. This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has five properties:
  • node: any - A node reference.
  • angle: float - An angle of rotation about the axis.
  • azimuth: float - An azimuth of the axis of rotation in degrees in the parent's space.
  • elevation: float - An elevation of the axis of rotation in degrees in the parent's space.
  • axis: float[] - An axis of rotation in cartesian coordinates in the parent's space.
An axis of rotation in animation keys is stored in cartesian coordinates, in UI an axis of rotation is displayed in polar coordinates using azimuth and elevation.
attachRotating.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.vk.tools.AxisAngleRotationTool

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.vk.tools.AxisAngleRotationTool itself
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

sap.ui.vk.tools.AxisAngleRotationTool.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new AxisAngleRotationTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableSnapping enableSnapping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEditingUI showEditingUI} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAllowContextMenu allowContextMenu} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getNodeSet nodeSet} : sap.ui.vk.tools.ToolNodeSet (default: Highlight)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:rotating rotating} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:rotated rotated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.

Default value is false.

parameters.bEnableStepping: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableStepping

sap.ui.vk.tools.RotateTool.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RotateTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCoordinateSystem coordinateSystem} : sap.ui.vk.tools.CoordinateSystem (default: World)
    • {@link #getAxis axis} : sap.ui.vk.tools.RotatableAxis (default: All)
    • {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableSnapping enableSnapping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEditingUI showEditingUI} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAutoResetValues autoResetValues} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAllowContextMenu allowContextMenu} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getNodeSet nodeSet} : sap.ui.vk.tools.ToolNodeSet (default: Highlight)
    • {@link #getPlacementMode placementMode} : sap.ui.vk.tools.GizmoPlacementMode (default: Default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:rotating rotating} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:rotated rotated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:axisChanged axisChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:coordinateSystemChanged coordinateSystemChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:placementModeChanged placementModeChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.

getPlacementMode.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getPlacementMode placementMode}. Sets the placement mode. Can be Default, ObjectCenter, or Custom Default value is Default.

getAutoResetValues.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAutoResetValues autoResetValues}. Determines if auto reset values mode is enabled Default value is true.

sap.ui.vk.Toolbar.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Toolbar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: "")
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getViewer viewer} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.Viewer)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getTitle.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTitle title}. Used to set the title of the Toolbar Default value is empty string.

sap.ui.vk.Toolbar.!helpDescription: Provides buttons to hide or show certain sap.ui.vk controls.

insertContent.!description: Inserts a content into the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

destroyContent.!description: Destroys all the content in the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

sap.ui.vk.tools.AnchorPointTool.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for an AnchorPointTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEditingUI showEditingUI} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAllowOperation allowOperation} : sap.ui.vk.tools.AnchorPointToolOperation (default: All)
    • {@link #getAllowContextMenu allowContextMenu} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getPosition position} : any
    • {@link #getQuaternion quaternion} : any
  • Events
    • {@link #event:moving moving} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:moved moved} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:rotating rotating} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:rotated rotated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.

attachMoved.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:moved moved} event of this sap.ui.vk.tools.AnchorPointTool. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.tools.AnchorPointTool itself. This event will be fired when movement finished.

sap.ui.vk.tools.ScaleTool.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ScaleTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCoordinateSystem coordinateSystem} : sap.ui.vk.tools.CoordinateSystem (default: World)
    • {@link #getNonUniformScaleEnabled nonUniformScaleEnabled} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableSnapping enableSnapping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEditingUI showEditingUI} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAutoResetValues autoResetValues} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAllowContextMenu allowContextMenu} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getNodeSet nodeSet} : sap.ui.vk.tools.ToolNodeSet (default: Highlight)
    • {@link #getPlacementMode placementMode} : sap.ui.vk.tools.GizmoPlacementMode (default: Default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:scaling scaling} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:scaled scaled} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:coordinateSystemChanged coordinateSystemChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:placementModeChanged placementModeChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.

getPlacementMode.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getPlacementMode placementMode}. Sets the placement mode. Can be Default, ObjectCenter, or Custom Default value is Default.

getAutoResetValues.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAutoResetValues autoResetValues}. Determines if auto reset values mode is enabled Default value is true.

fireScaling.!description: Fires event {@link #event:scaling scaling} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setEnableStepping.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping}. If set to true values will change in round number increments instead of continual change When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bEnableStepping: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableStepping

setNonUniformScaleEnabled.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getNonUniformScaleEnabled nonUniformScaleEnabled}. If set to true then this tool will enable scaling along a single axis, otherwise it will scale objects along all three axes proportionally When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bNonUniformScaleEnabled: type: boolean, description: New value for property nonUniformScaleEnabled

setPlacementMode.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPlacementMode placementMode}. Sets the placement mode. Can be Default, ObjectCenter, or Custom When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Default.

parameters.sPlacementMode: type: sap.ui.vk.tools.GizmoPlacementMode, description: New value for property placementMode

getEnableStepping.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping}. If set to true values will change in round number increments instead of continual change Default value is false.

getNodeSet.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getNodeSet nodeSet}. Determine what set of nodes will be transformed with this tool Default value is Highlight.

sap.ui.vk.Overlay.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Overlay. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getZoomOnResize zoomOnResize} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAreas areas} : sap.ui.vk.OverlayArea[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getTarget target} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:click click} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contextMenu contextMenu} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.ViewGroup.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new View Group. The objects of this class contain necessary information about View Group Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties

sap.ui.vk.RedlineSurface.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RedlineSurface. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getVirtualLeft virtualLeft} : float
    • {@link #getVirtualTop virtualTop} : float
    • {@link #getVirtualSideLength virtualSideLength} : float
    • {@link #getPanningRatio panningRatio} : float (default: 1)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getRedlineElements redlineElements} : sap.ui.vk.RedlineElement[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pan pan} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:zoom zoom} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

hasChildren.!description: The indicator showing if the node has child nodes. This property is read-only.

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

backgroundColorBottom.!description: Viewport background bottom color in the CSS Color format

showSafeArea.!description: Shows or hides the Safe Area

showAllHotspotsTintColor.!description: Color used to highlight all hotspots when the showAllHotspots property has a value of true.

showAllHotspots.!description: Enables or disables showing of all hotspots

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

upDirection.!description: Camera up vector in global space (normalized x, y, z vector values)

localMatrix.!description: The local transformation matrix of the node.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

veIds.!description: The node VE IDs. This property is read-only.

autoStartRendering.!description: Automatically start rendering This will allow client code to control if viewport rendering should commence automatically or not.

targetDirection.!description: Camera direction vector in global space (normalized x, y, z vector values)

nodeRef.!description: The node reference. This property is read-only.

tintColorABGR.!description:
The tint color.
The tint color is a 32-bit integer in the ABGR notation, where A is amount of blending between material color and tint color.

name.!description: The name of the node. This property is read-only.

position.!description: Camera position in global space (x, y, z coordinates)

hotspotColorABGR.!description: Color used for highlighting hotspots in the ABGR format

hotspotColor.!description: Color used for highlighting hotspots in the CSS Color format

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

showDebugInfo.!description: Shows or hides the debug info.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

backgroundColorTop.!description: Viewport background top color in the CSS Color format

nodeMetadata.!description: The node metadata. This property is read-only.

worldMatrix.!description: The world transformation matrix of the node.

enumerateAncestors.!description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.
enumerateAncestors.!type: fn(nodeRef: Object, callback: fn(), passNodeRef?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy

parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The reference object of a node whose ancestor nodes we want enumerated.
parameters.passNodeRef:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to pass the reference objects of the ancestor nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the reference objects of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the ancestor nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.
